p: The biological properties of restoration materials are essential to obtain good results, particularly in the case of implants. Specifically, given that the intermediate abutments are structures in close contact with the implant and with gingival tissue, the cell lines of this tissue must be adapted around them [ 10, 25, 26, 35]. Keratinocytes represent the main line of keratinized gingiva, whereas gingiva fibroblasts create the extracellular matrix, collagen and stroma that surround the keratinocyte layer [ 6, 36].
